go_data.justification: Nephronectin is an extracellular matrix protein, synthesized by the ureteric bud epithelium and localized with alpha8beta1 at the interface between the ureteric bud and the metanephric mesenchyme.
Nephronectin binds to integrin alpha8beta1 in an RGD-sensitive fashion.
Nephronectin is expressed in the developing kidney and is likely important for regulating kidney development.
Nephronectin mediates alpha8beta1 function during development, suggesting a role in cell-matrix adhesion.
